result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Joseph Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 1 in Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-48 and Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-89
Consecutive to: Count 1 in Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-48 and Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-89.
Consecutive to: Count 1 in Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-48 and Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-89.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay court costs in the amount of $263.00.
Defendant shall pay a DNA Analysis Surcharge in the amount of $250.00.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall comply with any and all mental health regiments including the prescription of medications and/or therapy and sign all necessary releases to allow communication between treatment providers and the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

Defendant shall pay restitution in the amount of $405.45 to Lelle's Bar (Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-93).
Defendant shall pay restitution in the amount of $512.50 to Randy Steiner (Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-92).
Defendant shall pay restitution in the amount of $200.00 to Brunkow Cheese (Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-94).
Defendant shall pay restitution in the amount of $1,200.00 to Matt Anderson d/b/a Yellowstone Dairy Bar (Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-90).

Defendant shall serve 6 months in the Lafayette County Jail.

Defendant shall pay court costs in the amount of $243.00.

Case called at 3:03 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court raises PSI issue
Attorney Pecora and his client wish to proceed to sentencing.
State calls Roger McDermott
>Roger McDermott affirmed and testifies
State moves for recommendation of PSI
Attorney Pecora concurs with the state and makes statement on behalf of his client.
Defendant makes statement to the court
Court:
Count 1:
8 years Imposed and stayed 3 yrs. IC and 5 yrs. ES
5 yrs probation consecutive to confinement time in 15-CF-48, 15-CF-89 and Count 2 15-CF-93
Restitution $405.45 Lelles Bar (15-CF-93), $512.50 Randy Steiner (15-CF-92), $200.00 Brunkow Cheese (15-CF-94) & $1,200.00 Matt Anderson Yellowstone Dairy Bar (15-CF-90).
Costs, AODA, No consumption/establishments, Submit to testing, Other probation rules, Counseling & Mental health treatment.
Defendant eligible for SAP & CIP.
Count 2
6 months County Jail Consecutive to sentence ordered in Laf. Co. Case 15-CF-48 & 15-CF-89.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:52 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.   Katherine Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Pecora informs the court this matter is resolved.
Defendant withdrawals his plea of "NOT GUILTY" and enters a plea of "GUILTY" to Counts 1 & 2.
Defendant sworn at 3:08 PM.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights.
Court also question attorney Pecora re: his clients plea and waiver.
Parties stipulate that there is a factual basis.
Court finds plea and waive is made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Counts 1 & 2.
Attorney Pecora moves to waive PSI, State concurs with attorney Pecora and moves for plea agreement of the parties.
Court orders PSI to be completed by September 28, 2016.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 10:12 AM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Pecora moves to continue for a global offer on all cases.
No objection  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 2:12 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Pecora moves for 30 day continuance and requests to be heard on bond modification.
State objects to any modification at this time.
Attorney Pecora responds to the state's objection.
Court "DENIES" any modification at this time.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 3:54 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Nancy L. Moore.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Moore moves for withdrawal for reasons stated on the record.
Court grants motion and signs the order.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

 Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
